channel.title: MMINDI Connect Santa Fe 2016 Reunion (June 24-26, 2016)
channel.description: MMINDI Connect Santa Fe Reunion, June 24-26, 2016 site information, etc.

item.title: Who-and-Where-Is-Coming
item.description: The Who Is Coming? and Where From? pages working. If you're planning to come but haven't registered, get on it!

item.title: Registration
item.description:
The Registration Form Is now open for the Santa Fe 2016 MMINDI "Connect" Reunion! (yay!) You can click on it here or on the link on the left side. Once we have some registrations, we'll start posting a list of who is going on the link below it. David has already posted a list on Facebook informally.

Registration deadline will be June 5th. Cancellations after the deadline will result in the loss of the registration fee.

Any issues, email us @MMINDIConnect or make a note on our FaceBook group page and we'll check on it!

item.title: Accommodations Update
item.description:
Lower cost location arranged by David at the Garrett's Desert Inn within 10 minute walk (according to Google Maps).

In addition to the La Posada De Santa Fe, which is where the reunion for Friday night and our gatherings will be held, there is a place about 8-10 minutes away (walking) that David has arranged for a lower cost room solution for those willing to walk back and forth... David says: "I wanted to follow up with the name of the less expensive option for lodging in Santa Fe for the reunion. The name of the hotel is Garrett's Desert Inn, and the phone number is (505) 982-1851. A recent quote for the time of the reunion starts at $109.00".

Any issues, email us @MMINDIConnect or make a note on our FaceBook group page and we'll check with him!

item.title: Draft Agenda
item.description:
*subject to change - 2016.02.21

Friday Evening -- Meet and Greet

  • Check in to the La Posada Hotel, and then join us at the indoor/ outdoor bar next to the Staab House restaurant for a meet and greet w/appetizers. (Time: 6:00 P.M. to ?)

$35 Friday Night Event; there will be cash bar.


Saturday Day -- On your own - List of possible activities you might be interested in...


Trolley Tour

  • Santa Fe tours for $15.00 per person or/and do any of the following on-your-own. Note: if enough interest will work out a group.

Canyon Road

  • Canyon Road is one of Santa Fe's most beautiful treasures, featuring art galleries of every kind. Walk and shop through a seemingly endless representation of art genres, including sculpture gardens and modern works. When you get to the top of the hill, have a margarita at Geronimo or El Farol. Currently on their schedule is the Santa Fe Farmer's Market for the Saturday we're there.

Raft the Taos Box

  • The Santa Fe Rafting Company hosts all day trips down the Rio Grande through the Taos Box. Trips depart at 9:00 A.M. and return at approximately 5:30 P.M. Lunch is served on the river. This past season the price was $99.00 per person. *note: this isn't organized by us, this is on your own!

    Phone: (505) 988-4914

Ten Thousand Waves

  • Santa Fe's premier Japanese Spa offers massage, facials, and public or private tubs. Stay for a couple of hours or relax all day at this exceptional outdoor treasure.

    Call and reserve a treatment: (505) 982-9304


Saturday Evening -- Casual dinner at Cafe Fina!

  • The shuttle will leave La Posada at 7:00 P.M to Cafe Fina. After dinner, we will regroup at "The Palace Saloon" for drinks and dancing.

$60.00; includes bus, dinner, and tips; excluding alchohol


Sunday Afternoon -- On your own

  • Enjoy brunch on your own at La Posada, then hang out at the pool, shop or enjoy beautiful Santa Fe on foot or by pedi-cab.

If you arrive early or stay late, there are many more options for nearby excursions to places like Tent Rocks, Madrid, Taos, Abiquiu Lake, and Nambe Falls.*



Registration is forthcoming, there will be a Registration fee.

item.title: Accommodations
item.description:
Accommodations

The reunion will be held at the La Posada De Santa Fe, a one-of-a-kind resort and spa featuring Pueblo revival architecture. The resort sits on 6 acres in the heart of downtown Santa Fe, so walking anywhere is truly convenient.

Currently there is a modest block of rooms reserved; however, as reservations are made, the number of rooms will be increased depending on interest in attendance.

The price of the rooms are $199.00 for a standard, stunning, and $299.00, more stunning, for a suite.

The phone number for the hotel and reservations is (505) 986-0000, and the event is under the name Notre Dame International. David says to contact him if there is any confusion - but rather than post his # here, post on our Facebook MMINDI Contacts page first and we'll check with him!

As of March 15, 2016, David has come up with a lower cost location approximately 10 minutes away (walking). The name of the hotel is Garrett's Desert Inn, and the phone number is (505) 982-1851. A recent quote for the time of the reunion starts at $109.00.

item.title: Transportation
item.description:
Santa Fe is located approximately 1 hour from Albuquerque, New Mexico. It is also possible to fly into Santa Fe; however, transportation arrangements from the Santa Fe Airport should be made ahead of time through the taxi service (505-438-0000).

There are several car rental options from the Albuquerque Airport in addition to shuttle services, and if you are adventurous you can take the Railrunner, train, from downtown Albuquerque.

If you choose to take the shuttle, the Sandia Shuttle Express operates from the Albuquerque Airport to Santa Fe throughout the day. The phone number is (888) 775-5696, and the price is $28.00, one way, and $48.00 for a round trip. The shuttle will drop you off at the La Posada in Santa Fe.

The Railrunner train service runs from Albuquerque to Santa Fe eleven times a day on weekdays*: 4:32 A.M., 5:02 A.M., 6:22 A.M., 7:19 A.M., 8:42 A.M., 9:35 A.M., 4:26 P.M., 5:34 P.M., 6:48 P.M., 7:42 P.M., and 8:38 P.M. The phone number for the Railrunner is (866) 795-RAIL (7245) and the price is $10:00 one-way. If you take the Railrunner you will have to take a cab from the Albuquerque Airport to the downtown train station, which is about 10 to 15 minutes away from the airport. When you arrive in Santa Fe, you will have to get a cab to La Posada.

Pricing and schedules are subject to change, they were correct at the time they were investigated.

item.title: David Signs Contract
item.description: David Trujillo, our site host, has secured the wonderful La Posada De Santa Fe and signed the contract reserving a block of rooms at a reduced rates. David says on Facebook: "The contract is signed. June 24, 25, and 26. Regular room $199 (beautiful by the way) and suites $299. Central location. We can walk to everything. I'm also working on a less pricey option; however, June in santa fe is high season. I'm working on day trips to Bandalier and rafting. Santa Fe is packed with so many options."

item.title: MMINDI Connect Santa Fe 2016 Site is Live
item.description:
Welcome to the MMI NDI Connect Santa Fe 2016 site. This is where you will find all the information regarding the upcoming 2016, June 24-26 Santa Fe Reunion. David Trujillo, NDI '85, is our site host.

There are several folks behind the scenes who will be involved, and probably don't even know it yet. ;-) But they will be credited as we move forward!

First of all, if you're not already aware - there is a large Facebook Contingent of MMI and NDI alumni on Facebook. Contact us here with your name, class year, school, and facebook/email info so we can connect you to the closed group. We might ask you a stupid question to make sure it's you. ;-)

Framework Credit: the original theme for this site comes from the original theme on github.
